all right hi guys i'm john true i am the founder of quality and today we're going to be talking
about one of the frontiers of cloud technology which is cloud automation testing and i
hope you guys are excited because first we're going to start by talking about your problems uh so the development process has a lot of issues
right your engineering team runs into long test suites and these test suites prevent them from
doing work so when they're waiting for things to happen they're not actually working and broken builds
also cause lots of problems because when the build breaks your entire team is blocked from doing work
they're annoyed they're frustrated and they're prevented from shipping product and this is exactly why we built quality
to solve all of these problems and we've delivered real results to our customers so we've taken an 80-minute
test suite down to six minutes and 40 build breaks a month to zero so you're probably wondering how
we do this and it's done with the help of aws so quality is a deployed service it goes
into your aws cloud and it sits behind your vpc so you can firewall everything off and keep all
your code secure and then it will just manage the spinning up and spinning down of ec2 test executors to allow your
engineers to push more changes if you need heavy throughput it'll just spin up more ec2 machines if you want faster parallelization for
faster test suites you can you can have higher parallelization and it'll just manage the spinning up and down of the
test executors in the test cluster so let's take a look at how this actually
looks to the engineer on the front end when he's actually using the product so on the left here we have
changes coming in in the center these are just different stages of the change and on the right is live console output
coming out in real time from the test cluster so your engineer knows exactly what's going on
so what quality actually does is it holds all of your changes in this limbo state and only merges it back into the
repository if things pass and that way it keeps things in limbo state and doesn't show other people if
the build's going to break and that's how prevents broken builds and as we see here the multiple spinners
coming up these are multiple instances that we've just spawned in ec2 paralyzing your test suite and making
things run really quickly and this particular change would have failed so you would have kept in the
limbo state and broken build would have been prevented so your team will not be angry
but i'm really proud to announce a new feature today here on stage which is the private debug instance and it's actually
pretty neat we built this originally so that you could solve the use case where if an engineer has a test
that works on his machine and fails in the testing cluster he can actually just get something on the testing cluster to
debug things on so the way you actually use this is you click on a change
and you hit the launch debug instance button and at this point what quality does is it spins up a brand new instance
in your testing cluster provisions it exactly how all the other testing machines look hands you ssh access to it and allows
you to just work on that machine and our customers have been really innovative with this so
some of them actually do some neat stuff so one of them has every dev just have a private debug instance at all times and
they just throw code on these instances to give themselves almost a staging like environment to test things on while they're iterating
and another one actually has qa select changes from quality spin up these debug instances reuse the
artifacts and just qa changes live on the fly which really shortens iteration loop for them
so developer productivity problems right this is very expensive companies have looked at these problems in the past you
have like facebook and google they have these giant internal systems that they've spent millions and millions on
and you have to maintain these systems for the lifetime of your company so it doesn't make sense for most people
which is why we've picked up some awesome customers and the one missing on this slide is
actually airbnb who got their entire engineering organization switched over to quality last week

market as medium-sized businesses that have their own custom application
and want to be able to accept mobile payments inside that app without having to switch to
another app for mobile payments so how does car flat work car flight works by we one firstly we
provide a piece of hardware an encrypted mag stripe reader which connects to your iphone or android app
secondly with just a few lines of code and now sdk you can get mobile payments up and
running uh we expect under an hour for you to be processing mobile payments inside your app and
thirdly we support your processor so we're agnostic in terms of our processing back end so you as a
mid-sized level business you don't need to change to a different processor
but we support up to 23 different processors today and the great thing about car flight is
that we manage the end-to-end encryption and pci compliance with inside your app so you don't have to
worry about um any of that sort of integration within your app you can just focus on building your own
custom application inside your app so aws we're very excited to be using
aws because aws has really helped us as a business to break down our pci compliance scope
down to the smallest unit of work possible so that as we grow and scale we can spawn up uh various amis into
different availability zones different regions around the world so that we can scale and we can focus on what we do really
well which is mobile payments and the great thing about aws is we went
on a fact-finding mission to find out because as a startup you don't want to focus on pci compliance you want to
focus on building your product getting that nvp out getting it out as quick as possible so we did a bit of a research and found
that amazon came up on trump's in terms of the amount of developer hours it would
take a developer for a card fight to become pci compliant and as you can see from this graphic it

as mobile payments developers to focus on us building the application and for aws

frank and i spent two two plus years working together at twilio and we really really love building and

earlier this year we launched our run scope traffic inspector the run scope traffic inspector allows you to capture requests from any application
in any language or framework to any api all by only changing the host name with no other changes to your code
once you've captured a request you can view it in the request inspector which just lets you see full request and response data share that data with
others retry it right from the web and get live search feeds of your traffic data as it flows through the system
thousands of the top or yeah thousands of the top companies in the thousands of the top companies in the world have used our service
and so far we have captured over 25 million api calls with our debugging tools now when you're trying to debug a

so amazon web services has given us the tools to provide a scalable fault tolerant infrastructure
and from the very beginning from the very beginning we were built as a service oriented
architecture we have over 18 independent services running on ec2 across multiple availability zones
all of our services are registered in route 53 and using a combination of route53 health
checks and our own internal tools we're able to automatically detect when a service fails and remove that service from our cluster
before our customers ever see a problem now another thing when you're working with apis is network performance
that's a top priority for you so aws has allowed us to build out service regions in australia
ireland and both the us coasts with these service regions we're able to offer low latency
performance to all of our customers one of our customers based in new zealand uh recently switched from our us
east region to our australia region and saw traffic go from seven seconds down to under a hundred milliseconds and
as you can imagine they were pretty happy about that performance boost so we've built some great debugging tools we have really rock solid
